<target_code>
Here is the code of metal_linux_bus_finish:
```c
void metal_linux_bus_finish(void)
{
	struct linux_bus *lbus;
	struct metal_bus *bus;

	for_each_linux_bus(lbus) {
		if (metal_bus_find(lbus->bus_name, &bus) == 0)
			metal_bus_unregister(bus);
	}
}
```

explanation: No language extensions are used in the provided code fragments. The macro for_each_linux_bus expands to a standard for loop and uses pointer arithmetic and struct member access, all standard C. There are no compiler-specific keywords or constructs present (for example: no __attribute__, __asm__/asm, typeof, statement-expressions ({ ... }), nested functions, GCC __label__ or other vendor built-ins) and no non-standard array/struct declarations. Therefore there are no fragments that need to be investigated for Rule 1.2 (use of language extensions).
